page.title: 18Staploe Council and Services
page.content: The parish council, restructured in 1965, following County boundary changes, has 7 elected members and meets 6 times a year. The annual precept is Â£850, much of which is spent on electricity for the 3 or 4 street lights in each hamlet. Each has its own "Festival of Britain" village sign, "Jubilee" seat, Council notice-board and telephone kiosk. Each enters the Best Kept Village contest. Staploe in 1963 and Duloe in 1983 won the "Small Village" category. The award trees were planted in the winning hamlets and certificates hang in the Village Hall. There is a weekly garbage collection and from time to time a skip is provided for larger items. For several years the 10 trees offered annually by the County have been planted along roads in the parish.
